abstract: The author pauses on a rainy day to reflect and answer readers' questions about eating and what he carried (and what he needed).
snippet: The author pauses on a rainy day to reflect and answer readers' questions about eating and what he carried (and what he needed).
lead_paragraph: JONAS, Pa. -- Rain and a gusty headwind kept me to a half day's riding on Wednesday, slowing my progress home, though I'm not entirely bummed about that. It's pretty here. I'm about 100 miles from Manhattan, having climbed some roller-coaster hills and wound a woodsy path through Hickory Run State Park, and I expect to cross the George Washington Bridge in the middle of the day Saturday. Yeah, it's about time to be back in my own bed like a settled adult and in the newsroom like a reporter with a real job.

headline.main: 100 Miles From Manhattan, Feeling Both Young and Old
